segment.source: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects (Windows 10)
segment.target: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects (Windows 10)

segment.source: This guide explains the process of setting up advanced security auditing capabilities that are made possible through settings and events that were introduced in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: This guide explains the process of setting up advanced security auditing capabilities that are made possible through settings and events that were introduced in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
segment.target: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This guide explains the process of setting up advanced security auditing capabilities that are made possible through settings and events that were introduced in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: This guide explains the process of setting up advanced security auditing capabilities that are made possible through settings and events that were introduced in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: These procedures can be deployed with the advanced security auditing capabilities described in Deploy Security Auditing with Central Audit Policies (Demonstration Steps).
segment.target: These procedures can be deployed with the advanced security auditing capabilities described in Deploy Security Auditing with Central Audit Policies (Demonstration Steps).

segment.source: In this guide
segment.target: In this guide

segment.source: Domain administrators can create and deploy expression-based security audit policies by using file classification information (resource attributes), user claims, and device claims to target specific users and resources to monitor potentially significant activities on one or more computers.
segment.target: Domain administrators can create and deploy expression-based security audit policies by using file classification information (resource attributes), user claims, and device claims to target specific users and resources to monitor potentially significant activities on one or more computers.

segment.source: These policies can be deployed centrally by using Group Policy, or directly on a computer, in a folder, or in individual files.
segment.target: These policies can be deployed centrally by using Group Policy, or directly on a computer, in a folder, or in individual files.

segment.source: In this section
segment.target: In this section

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Monitor the central access policies that apply on a file server
segment.target: Monitor the central access policies that apply on a file server

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that apply to a file server when using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that apply to a file server when using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Central access policies are created on a domain controller and then applied to file servers through Group Policy management.
segment.target: Central access policies are created on a domain controller and then applied to file servers through Group Policy management.

segment.source: Monitor the use of removable storage devices
segment.target: Monitor the use of removable storage devices

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor attempts to use removable storage devices to access network resources.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor attempts to use removable storage devices to access network resources.

segment.source: It describes how to use advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: It describes how to use advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor resource attribute definitions
segment.target: Monitor resource attribute definitions

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to resource attribute definitions when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to resource attribute definitions when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor central access policy and rule definitions
segment.target: Monitor central access policy and rule definitions

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to central access policy and central access rule definitions when you use advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to central access policy and central access rule definitions when you use advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor user and device claims during sign-in
segment.target: Monitor user and device claims during sign-in

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor user and device claims that are associated with a user’s security token when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor user and device claims that are associated with a user’s security token when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor the resource attributes on files and folders
segment.target: Monitor the resource attributes on files and folders

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor attempts to change settings to the resource attributes on files when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor attempts to change settings to the resource attributes on files when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor the central access policies associated with files and folders
segment.target: Monitor the central access policies associated with files and folders

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that are associated with files and folders when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to the central access policies that are associated with files and folders when you are using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects.

segment.source: Monitor claim types
segment.target: Monitor claim types

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to claim types that are associated with dynamic access control when you are using advanced security auditing options.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to claim types that are associated with dynamic access control when you are using advanced security auditing options.

segment.source: Important: This procedure can be configured on computers running any of the supported Windows operating systems.
segment.target: Important: This procedure can be configured on computers running any of the supported Windows operating systems.

segment.source: The other monitoring procedures can be configured only as part of a functioning dynamic access control deployment.
segment.target: The other monitoring procedures can be configured only as part of a functioning dynamic access control deployment.
